title: Complete Question Types Demo Quiz
description: Covers all 14 question types with examples

questions.question: What is the output of: console.log(typeof null)?
questions.explanation: typeof null returns 'object', which is a known JavaScript quirk

questions.question: Which of the following are JavaScript frameworks? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: React, Angular, and Vue are JavaScript frameworks. Python is a language and Django is a Python framework

questions.question: JavaScript is a statically typed language.
questions.explanation: JavaScript is dynamically typed, not statically typed

questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language

questions.question: Explain the difference between var, let, and const in JavaScript. Provide examples.
questions.sampleAnswer: var has function scope and is hoisted. let has block scope and cannot be redeclared in the same scope. const also has block scope but cannot be reassigned. Example: var can be used anywhere in function, let only in its block, const value cannot change.
questions.explanation: Understanding variable declarations is fundamental in JavaScript

questions.question: The ___ keyword is used to declare a constant in JavaScript, and ___ is used for block-scoped variables.
questions.explanation: const declares constants, let declares block-scoped variables

questions.question: Match the HTTP method with its purpose:
questions.explanation: GET retrieves, POST creates, PUT updates, DELETE removes

questions.question: Arrange the following steps in the correct order for the Software Development Life Cycle:
questions.explanation: SDLC: Requirements → Design → Implementation → Testing → Deployment → Maintenance

questions.question: What will be the output of the following code?
questions.explanation: == does type coercion (true), === checks type and value (false)

questions.question: Write a function that takes an array of numbers and returns the sum of all even numbers.

questions.question: If a function has time complexity O(n²) and processes 100 items, approximately how many operations will it perform?
questions.explanation: O(n²) means n * n operations, so 100 * 100 = 10,000
